A blockade is a cordon of ships used to prevent the enemy from trading through a port or moving any fleet that is based there. You can blockade a port by right-clicking on it as you would another fleet. If there is an enemy fleet inside, a cordon graphic will appear to indicate a blockade is under way. Otherwise, your fleet will sail straight into the port and occupy it.
Use the spacebar to speed up movement of all characters, armies or fleets on the campaign map. Press the spacebar again to slow them down again.
We should concentrate our efforts on building a Fur Trading Post here.
We should concentrate our efforts on recruiting a unit of Native Lancers here.
We should concentrate our efforts on recruiting a unit of 12-lber Garrison Artillery here.
We should concentrate our efforts on recruiting a unit of Musellims here.
There is unused land suitable for plantations in this region. Building plantations here will increase your nation's export capacity, improving income through international trade.
Using your cavalry to attack camels is not likely to be very effective. The horrible smell of camels spooks horses!
We should concentrate our efforts on recruiting a unit of Scots here.
We should concentrate our research efforts on Shortened Carbines.
Tire your enemy out by keeping them constantly occupied. Make them rush about by offering some advantage, for example by moving fast light troops into a vulnerable position.
You can move your Gentleman by right-clicking on any part of the highlighted area. He will move within the extent of it but no further in one turn. Right-click on a character to interact with him.
We should concentrate our efforts on recruiting a unit of Militia Musketeers here.

Nimble, light troops may prove more effective when fighting elephants than heavier infantry, as a lightly equipped man can dodge and move quickly to avoid blows. The rigid formations of standard infantry allow little scope for avoiding the charge of these beasts.

An ungarrisoned city automatically generates Armed Citizenry - a sort of "watch" - to keep order. Although not as effective during an insurrection as billeted light infantry - such as Dragoons - Armed Citizenry are well able to manage day to day public order problems. They cannot leave the city in which they were spawned.
We should concentrate our efforts on recruiting a unit of Grenadiers here.
We should concentrate our efforts on building an Engineer School here.
This tab lists all your regions, their population, public order status, and income. It can be sorted by each of those headings.
We should concentrate our research efforts on the Pocket Chronometer.
We should concentrate our efforts on building a Great Arsenal here.
We should concentrate our efforts on building a 120-Gun First Rate and recruiting its crew here.
Now left-click on the Colonial Militia unit card to put it into the recruitment queue.
Of all troops, lighter infantry are the best suited to take on elephants. Light troops can dodge blows and make attacks quicker than their more heavily armed colleagues.
We should concentrate our research efforts on Empiricism.

Clicking on the infiltrate button means your agent will begin spying upon arrival at his destination. If he is successful you will be able to see more information about the buildings and troops inside. As with all subterfuge actions there is a percentage chance of success, and failure may mean capture and execution.
We should concentrate our efforts on building a Theatre here.
We should concentrate our research efforts on Steam-Pumped Land Drainage.
We should concentrate our research efforts on the Wedge Formation.
We should concentrate our efforts on recruiting a unit of Siberian Hunters here.

When attacking an enemy that is deployed on a hill, attack up the most gentle slope, even if it takes a while to get there. Most troops will not be exhausted by the time they reach the top of the slope.
We should concentrate our efforts on building a Silver Pit here.
The government details panel gathers together essential statistics and information for the management of your entire empire.
Attacking pikemen or bayonet-equipped infantry from the front is a good way to kill off your cavalry units. Attack from the flank or rear - or better still, use infantry!

When preparing for a melee attack, it can sometimes work to your advantage to let the enemy have the first shot. If your men don't break under the hail of musket balls, they could engage before the enemy reloads.

The delay phase allows you to use the weather to your advantage by picking the optimum conditions for your units to fight in. For instance, if the enemy have a lot of gunpowder weapons fighting in the rain will reduce their effectiveness.

Unhappiness is the first stage on the road to rebellion. At this stage the problem can be dealt with by an upgrade to the governor's building, or an increase in garrison size. Alternatively, taverns, conservatoriums, and related buildings will bring contentment to many, without having to resort to the sabre!
We should concentrate our efforts on building a Water-Powered Cotton Mill here.

Faith is being lost in your ability to secure victory in the current conflict. Every time a territory is lost, or even a battle, the populace become wearier of the war. This is indicated by increased unhappiness.

The withdraw button in the bottom right of the screen orders selected units to retreat from the field in an orderly manner. Withdraw if you want to save a unit to fight another day. To cancel the order simply give the withdrawing unit another order, or click on the withdraw button again.

It is possible to take a fort or city without risking a pitched battle. A patient General can throttle the fight out of the defenders by laying siege for several turns. This is time-consuming, but eventually hunger or an angry populace will force a surrender.
We should concentrate our efforts on building a Carpet Weaver's Cottage here.
We should concentrate our efforts on recruiting a unit of Bashi-Bazouks here.
We should concentrate our efforts on recruiting a Board of Ordnance 12-lber Howitzer Battery here.
We should concentrate our research efforts on Platoon Firing.
We should concentrate our efforts on recruiting a unit of Rocket Camels here.

You are successfully blockading an enemy trade port in their home region. Whilst this is in place no imports or exports can take place, and all income from sea-based trade coming through that port is suspended.
Terrain has an effect on a unit's movement speed. Sticking to roads or short grass will ensure your units move at maximum speed.

The Revolutionary War has begun! Having suffered heavy casualties at the battle of Bunker Hill, the British have been left with little choice but to evacuate the city of Boston. American troops have moved in and the city is now under our control. However, the rest of the British army outnumbers us on both land and at sea, and is well supplied and disciplined. If the people of America are to be free, its fledgling army must find a way to overcome these odds. Perhaps Britain's oldest adversary - France - can be persuaded to balance the odds?
Now left-click on the fire at will button on the review panel at the bottom right of the screen.
We should concentrate our efforts on recruiting a unit of Rocket Troop here.
We should concentrate our efforts on recruiting a unit of Native American Warriors here.
We should concentrate our efforts on building a Coaching Inn here.
We should concentrate our efforts on building a School of the Arts here.
We should concentrate our research efforts on Explosive Shells.
We should concentrate our research efforts on Carbines.
This region is becoming poorer and poorer. Reduce the tax burden here and give wealth a chance!
We should concentrate our efforts on recruiting a unit of Desert Warriors here.
We should concentrate our efforts on recruiting a unit of Sakers here.

The flashing unit banner means the morale of their troops is wavering, before long they will break from combat and rout from the field. Take this opportunity to charge their ranks with cavalry or infantry with bayonets fixed. The battle is over when all troops in an army are routed or killed.
We should concentrate our efforts on building a National Observatory here.

The trade tab details all resources brought to your capital from across your empire, and shows how these are exported to your trade partners - together with the profit you make from exporting to each partner nation.

Your territory is vulnerable to attack by brigands. Brigands are organised robbers out for personal gain, and will reduce trade income in a region. Brigands spawn along roads, and may also attack towns and destroy resources.
Now that you have taken control of the centre, you must hold this position until your own flag reaches the top of the flag pole. If successful you will win the battle.

Fire or a lucky shot has got into an enemy magazine, igniting the powder stored therein. The resulting blast has not only annihilated the enemy, but also caught your own ship, causing severe damage to your vessel. It would be best to steer well clear of burning vessels, in order to prevent a repeat of this tragedy.

Artillery is able to target an area of ground, whether or not enemy troops occupy it. In this way, it can deny areas of the battlefield to the enemy, flush out hidden units, or destroy defences. Select any unlimbered artillery and right-click on an area of ground to bombard it. Click on the halt button to cancel the bombardment.
We should concentrate our efforts on building a Warrior Lodge here.

This panel shows statistical information about the selected region. The bottom section shows the rate of and factors contributing to population growth; the middle section details how the wealth level of individual towns affects the region as a whole; the top section shows the status of public order, split into two classes.

Obedience to the system of government within a nation is measured in public order. If unhappiness begins to outweigh happiness and state repression at any point then the resultant unrest can lead to rebellion, if left unchecked. Keeping taxes at reasonable levels, and leaving troops as a garrison, will in most cases keep order in a region.

The grey pips in the public order section of this panel represent state repression - either from your government type, or via intimidation from garrisoned units. Whilst it is useful to keep the population in order, rebellion following a period of heavy repression can be difficult to suppress.

The overall happiness of a population is split between the ruling class and lower orders, with different factors contributing to the happiness level of each. Rebellion becomes a risk when part of the population is so unhappy that state repression can no longer contain public disorder. Always try to ensure that public order values remain positive!

Unhappiness is the first stage on the road to rebellion. At this stage the problem can be dealt with by an upgrade to the governor's building, or an increase in garrison size. Alternatively, taverns, conservatoriums, and related buildings will bring contentment to many, without having to resort to the sabre!
We should concentrate our efforts on building a Monastery School here.
The missions tab gathers together information on active and archived missions for easy reference. Look here to check the time remaining for completion, or read the details of a mission again.
Don't start your attack by engaging the enemy's elite troops. In a perfect battle you would rout their army without fighting them at all.
We should concentrate our efforts on recruiting a General's Bodyguard here.

Unhappiness persists here due to the cultural differences between the population and their conquerors. It is much harder to keep a different culture happy. Over time these feelings fade as the populace adjusts to life under its new masters.

Use Rakes to damage enemy buildings through acts of sabotage. Right-click on a city and select a building to sabotage from the list. Your Rake will then move there and attempt to damage it upon his arrival.
We should concentrate our efforts on building a Seminary here.
We should concentrate our research efforts on Measuring Tools.
We should concentrate our efforts on building a State Barracks here.
We should concentrate our efforts on recruiting a unit of Superior Line Infantry here.
Mouse over the remaining enemy unit and right-click to attack.

This tab shows all units available for recruitment in the selected town, city, port, army or fleet. Right-click on a unit's picture to see its description. Left-click on a unit to add it to the queue, and again to remove it. Recruitment cost is displayed underneath, recruitment time is shown in the top left-hand corner.

A trade port in one of your colonies has been blockaded by an enemy fleet. Whilst this is in place it will not be possible to export goods from here to your home region. Act quickly to lift the blockade!
We should concentrate our efforts on building Vineyards here.
You can attack an enemy army by selecting your own army and then right-clicking on the enemy army.
We should concentrate our efforts on building a Sugar Warehouse here.

"Crossing the T" is the most effective way of battering an enemy into submission. Present your broadside to their bows or stern, so your cannon fire can then travel the length of their gundecks. The enemy will be unable to reply with his own broadside, so even weaker ships can be effective in this position.
We should concentrate our efforts on building a Coffee House here.
This panel gives you important information about a particular unit type: number of men, recruitment and upkeep costs, experience, statistics, special abilities, and a detailed description.
We should concentrate our efforts on building a Naval Board here.

Send multiple merchant ships here for an increased share of the goods, or raid trade routes to keep the income from reaching its wrongful destination! Remember though that attacking trade is an act of war!
We should concentrate our efforts on building an Eastern Large Fort here.
We should concentrate our research efforts on Free Trade Doctrine.
We should concentrate our efforts on recruiting a unit of Light Cavalry here.
We should concentrate our efforts on building an Ornamental Tulip Gardens here.
We should concentrate our efforts on building a Palatial Estate here.
This piece cannot move any further now. It will be available again next turn.
We should concentrate our efforts on recruiting a unit of Grenzers here.

Upgrade ports to dockyards for the ability to construct bigger and better fleets. Fleets can also be made stronger by merging them together as you would armies - simply select a fleet and then right-click on another that you wish to merge with.

Round shot is the most widely-used type of ammunition, and is used by all artillery as their default ammunition type. The round shot button in the bottom right of the screen allows you to select round shot.
We should concentrate our efforts on building an Admiralty here.

You currently have an active mission to construct a Local Fishery in your region. Jamestown cannot expand any further until you complete this mission. To accomplish this, left-click on the port on the campaign map to the east of Jamestown.

This slider adjusts the speed of the battle. You can pause the game by sliding it to the bottom, and return to normal speed by sliding it up one position. The two higher positions are for double and triple speed respectively.

Grenadiers are specialist assault troops well-suited to clearing occupied buildings and storming breeches at the head of a 'Forlorn Hope'. Though generally small units, their crude grenades can do a lot of damage, and their high morale means they are well able to take and hold a position until support arrives.

When assaulting a fort or settlement, many troop types can employ rope ladders anchored by grapnels to scale enemy walls. Selecting a unit then right-clicking on a section of wall orders the troops to deploy their ladders.

You are losing money hand over fist, very soon there will be no money left in your treasury. There are several things you can do to lift yourself out of the financial mire, including raising taxes if possible, establishing further trade agreements and trade routes, disbanding units to reduce upkeep costs, or sending more Indiamen merchant fleets to trade theatres.

The red line on the map represents the border of this region. Everything within this region is owned by you. Other nations can only enter this area if they are at war with you, or if they seek and gain your permission. Similarly, you cannot move into a region owned by another nation unless you are at war with them, or have gained permission.
We should concentrate our research efforts on Naval Architecture Advances.
We should concentrate our efforts on recruiting a unit of Guerillas here.
We should concentrate our efforts on recruiting a unit of Colonial Dragoons here.
We should concentrate our efforts on building a Star Fort with Earthworks here.
You can attack a fleet belonging to another nation when it is within the highlighted area. Right-click on a fleet to engage in naval combat.

Long-standing trade partners develop a healthy respect for each other, reflected by a gradual improvement in diplomatic relations and increased income from trade routes over the life of your agreement.
We should concentrate our efforts on building a First Rate Ship of the Line and recruiting its crew here.

When attacking a fort or city, a General can demand that the defenders surrender with the honours of war. If accepted, they will be allowed to leave unmolested, turning the fortifications over without a shot being fired.
Light cavalry beat light troops and heavy cavalry beat light cavalry. All cavalry are vulnerable to pikes and bayonets. Try to match your cavalry to the right target.

The formations button opens a browser from where you can select pre-set formations for the group you have selected. In the deployment phase, the selected ships will snap to their positions, whereas during battle they will take a while to sail there.

The Steamship harnesses the power of steam to propel it through the water. Free of the constraints of conventional wind-powered vessels, her captain may position her in almost any way he sees fit, making her a serious contender in all but the heaviest of engagements.
Keep your light horsemen out of hand-to-hand combat with camel troops. Camels smell, and this spooks horses and makes any cavalry less effective.
We should concentrate our efforts on recruiting a unit of Tufangis here.
We should concentrate our efforts on recruiting a unit of Cossack Infantry here.

The flashing unit banner means the morale of your troops is wavering, before long they will break from combat and rout from the field! Send your General to rally his men, or bolster their ranks with reinforcements. The battle is over when all troops in an army are routed or killed.

Ring bayonets are an improvement over plug bayonets. They offer all the advantages of plug bayonets, but having fixed them a unit can still fire, though at a slower speed. Fix and unfix ring bayonets using the bayonet toggle button in the lower right of the screen.

Fire has broken out aboard one of your ships! As her crew are manning the guns they are unable to fight the blaze. Order them to cease fire by deactivating the fire at will button. Whilst this is happening you will be unable to return enemy fire.
The riot in this region has grown into an armed rebellion. There is no more time to negotiate a peaceful solution - send troops in at once to defeat the rebels!
The wealth of your towns is decreasing rapidly. You are taxing the ruling class too much, and soon there won't be much left that can be taxed!
We should concentrate our efforts on building a Naval Hospital here.
We should concentrate our research efforts on Preserved Foods.
Now that you have broken through their walls, divert your heaviest troops to attack the breach at once. If the defenders have enough time to get ready, any advantage will be lost.
We should concentrate our efforts on building a Deep Gem Shaft here.
There is a degree of unrest in this region as the majority of the population follow a different religion to that of their rulers. Send missionaries to proselytise the true religion to the masses.
We should concentrate our efforts on building a Steam Drydock here.
This tab shows all fleets available for recruitment in the selected port or fleet, their available movement points, current status, and ship numbers. It can be sorted by each of those headings.

As gunpowder weapons take time to reload, take the opportunity to fix bayonets and charge their ranks! Even if they reload in time, you could be too close for their fire to be effective. To charge select your infantry, press the melee button and right-click on the enemy unit.
We should concentrate our efforts on building a Cotton Warehouse here.
We should concentrate our efforts on recruiting a unit of Sikh Warriors here.
We should concentrate our efforts on building a Seraglio here.
We should concentrate our efforts on building a Steam-Pumped Gold Mine here.
We should concentrate our efforts on recruiting a unit of Provincial Line Infantry here.
We should concentrate our research efforts on the Sextant.

Following your glorious victory at Bunker Hill, the British have evacuated Boston. The city is now under your control. Your army in Boston now contains troops that are battle hardened and buoyed by their success. However, the rest of the British army outnumbers us on both land and at sea, and is well supplied and disciplined. If the people of America are to be free, its fledgling army must find a way to overcome these odds. Perhaps Britain’s oldest adversary - France - can be persuaded to balance the odds?
BattlePlayerAlliancePercentageOfUnitCategoryTest

The group formations button in the bottom right of the screen brings up a set of standard formations for groups of units that can save you time and effort. Move your mouse over each formation button to see what it does.
We should concentrate our research efforts on Naval Shore Facilities.
We should concentrate our efforts on recruiting a unit of Militia Pikemen here.

During the deployment phase you can secretly arrange your units inside the deployment zone before battle commences. The enemy General will deploy his men within the opposite area. When you are ready to fight click on the crossed swords icon in the centre of the screen.
The enemy are planning to defend the river crossing. It doesn't look like there's anywhere else to cross, so you will have to mount a frontal attack.
Artillery can be a great incentive for a defending enemy on hilly terrain not to just sit there and wait for you. You can bombard them until they move to a more suitable place to die.
You can check the game date at a glance by looking in the bottom right-hand of the screen adjacent to the season.
We should concentrate our efforts on building a Large Coffee Plantation here.
We should concentrate our efforts on recruiting a unit of Afghan Hillmen here.
We should concentrate our research efforts on the Spinning Frame.
Camel riders are about to attack your cavalry. This is likely to go badly for your horsemen, as their mounts are upset by the strange smell and appearance of camels.

Rioting has broken out in this region as the lower orders have become too unhappy. You must either appease the rioters by lowering taxes or send in the troops to put them down. Whatever you do act quickly, before the riot becomes a rebellion!

The crescent formation is the naval equivalent of the pincer movement. Your fleet will fan out in line, with the outer ships in a progressively advanced position from the centre. Typically, larger ships form the centre, while lighter vessels position themselves on the flanks, serving to deny enemy ships room to manoeuvre. Once engaged, flanking vessels are ideally positioned to provide supporting fire.
We should concentrate our efforts on recruiting a unit of Firelock Armed Citizenry here.

The Revolutionary War has begun! Despite the loss at Bunker Hill, the British suffered such heavy casualties that they had little choice but to evacuate the city of Boston. American troops have moved in and the city is now under your control. However, the rest of the British army outnumbers us on both land and at sea, and is well supplied and disciplined. If the people of America are to be free, its fledgling army must find a way to overcome these odds. Perhaps Britain’s oldest adversary - France - can be persuaded to balance the odds?

With advances in military thinking and the relevant research, new firing drills will become available to many of your units. Unit commanders will more effectively direct fire on the enemy, resulting in an improved kill rate and a greater impact on morale.
We should concentrate our efforts on building Rice Farms here.
You are successfully raiding the enemy's trade along this route. Their income is reduced and goods are added to your own supply.
We should concentrate our research efforts on the Screw Breach.
We should concentrate our efforts on building a Pasha's Council here.
We should concentrate our efforts on building a Military Engineer School here.
Left-click on the dockyard icon to construct a dockyard.
We should concentrate our efforts on building a Small Arms Factory here.

Your first priority is to force the Spanish invaders from the continent. You will have to maintain peaceful relations with your fellow natives in order to do this, which is easier said than done, as the Plains Nations are notoriously hostile to outsiders - even non-Europeans. It is important that you do not use the same fighting styles when engaging European enemies on the battlefield – their drill and firepower will always be superior, but Pueblo warriors are skilled in irregular tactics and are finally a match for the Spanish in terms of horsemanship. Removing them from American soil will bring you into contact both with other native nations and the new nation of the United States, who will try to expand their territory westwards.

The Shaman is a tribe’s direct link with the world of the spirits, acting as a doctor, herbalist, priest, and sorcerer. You can assign him the task of researching technologies that will aid your nation in the struggle to survive and conquer your rivals. Shamans provide a bonus by speeding up research when inside cultural buildings, improve morale when inside your own armies, and will preach animism when positioned in a region. They also have the power to spy once inside rival settlements.

Ancillary characters are the retainers, assistants, and general hangers-on that great men accumulate during their careers. Characters will from time to time gain an ancillary, whose presence will affect their abilities. Ancillaries can be transferred between characters by clicking and dragging between information panels.

As the campaign begins, the Huron-Wyandot are surrounded by enemies. Defeated during the French and Indian war, your nation continues to be hated by the Iroquois Confederacy, and Great Britain will support their allies against your nation. As France no longer has a presence on the continent, you will have to maintain friendly relations with the Spanish and the Plains Nations for trade to flourish between you. This should enable you to concentrate your military efforts against the Iroquois, and to push Great Britain out of the traditional Huron homelands they currently occupy. It is important that you do not use European fighting styles when facing these enemies – their drill and firepower will always be superior, so you must use irregular tactics and make good use of your ability to hide in plain sight if victory is to be attained.

A Scout is the classic double agent – he appears to work for the nation he has infiltrated, but in reality spies for his own. When inside an army the Scout extends its line of sight, and whilst he is inside a rival force their position and contents will remain visible to you at all times. He can also sabotage their ability to move during that turn, effectively sending them on a wild goose chase. Scouts can also assassinate characters and infiltrate or sabotage buildings.

As a land-locked nation, your first priority should be to forge a trade agreement with the United States. Together with Great Britain, trade with the new nation will provide an income to fund your ongoing struggle against the hated Huron-Wyandot, your long-term enemies to the east. However, there is a time factor: the United States will eventually expand westwards, and will think nothing of betraying their native trade partners in order to achieve this. Beyond that, it is important to keep an eye on the suspicious Cherokee, who may look north in order to bolster their position against the Spanish aggressors. Finally, the recently-brokered, extremely fragile peace between Great Britain and the United States may soon falter. If that happens the Iroquois Confederacy will be caught in the crossfire.

Native tribes can generate extra income by the sale of land to European pioneers and gold prospectors. Pioneer buildings can be constructed on farmland, prospectors' camps can be built in regions where gold is a resource that can be mined. However, selling land to settlers generates unrest, and the presence of pioneers in a region can also result in conversion of the population to their religion.

Your first priority is to secure trade links with the United States, which will provide the finances required to build up your forces sufficiently to take on the hated Spanish oppressors, who are gradually encroaching in-land and into Cherokee territory. When fighting Europeans it is important that you do not fight in the same way – their drill and firepower are more advanced than your own, so you must use irregular tactics and make use of your ability to hide in plain sight if victory is to be secured. Beyond that, the Huron-Wyandot and Iroquois may provide your nation with new lands in which to flourish, but attacking the latter will undoubtedly cause conflict with Great Britain. If this occurs an alliance with the United States might be the most lucrative option.

Your first priority is to forge friendly diplomatic links with your fellow native nations, in order to facilitate trade of the animal pelts that are your livelihood and chief export. The next order of business is to fend off the inward march of the Spanish, so try to use the Pueblo Nations as a buffer whilst you build up your own. When fighting Europeans it is important that you do not mirror their fighting styles – their drill and firepower will always be superior, so you must use irregular tactics and make good use of your ability to remain hidden if victory is to be attained. Beyond that, the Huron-Wyandot are comparatively weak, and their regions should be easy pickings should you wish to expand your territory.
